article.title: $D$ - meson production at very forward rapidities: estimating the intrinsic charm contribution

choices: The effect of intrinsic charm on gluon distributions.
The rapidity distribution of D mesons.
Predictions of different intrinsic charm models for charm and gluon distributions.
The energy dependence of the total charm production cross section.

multiple_choice_question.text: What production mechanism is depicted in the left panel of Figure 2?
choices: Charm production from light quark-antiquark fusion.
Charm production from intrinsic charm in the projectile.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main conclusion drawn from Figure 3(b)?
choices: Different intrinsic charm models have a significant impact on the total charm cross section.
The choice of factorization scale heavily influences the total charm cross section.
The presence of intrinsic charm is crucial to describe the total charm cross section data.
Different intrinsic charm models have a negligible impact on the total charm cross section.
The cross section for heavy quark production in gluon-nucleon interactions.
The differential cross section of D meson production associated to charm in the initial state.
The rapidity distribution for a h1h2 collision.
The dipole-nucleon cross section in terms of the forward scattering amplitude.
